intro: Gilia brachysiphon, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert and arid environments. Gilia brachysiphon is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
